definition: to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to rack one's brains/to think hard

sentences.english: Many students in the course of employment because of their dedicated and halfheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多學生因爲求職過程的勞心勞力而對其敷衍了事。

sentences.english: He beat his brains over the matter for days.
sentences.chinese: 他爲這個問題勞心焦思了好些天。

sentences.english: At least we don't have to worry about Harbour Pointe any more.
sentences.chinese: 起碼來說，我們不必再爲波因特港工程勞心費力。

definition: to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to rise early and sleep late (idiom); to work hard/to study diligently/to burn the candle at both ends
(literary) (of a married woman) to visit one's parents
